article_title: Moderna-Merck Personalized mRNA Cancer Vaccine Sustains 49% Melanoma Risk Reduction at Five Years
summary: Submission approved - well-sourced article on significant cancer immunotherapy milestone

findings.details: Merck.com press release confirms: 49% risk reduction, HR 0.510 (95% CI 0.294-0.887), 157 patients, KEYNOTE-942 trial
WebProNews provides additional verified data: 62% reduction in distant metastasis, 5-year survival rates (75.3% vs 55.6% RFS)
targetedonc.com: https://www.targetedonc.com/view/rfs-benefit-sustained-at-5-years-for-intismeran-autogene-in-melanoma - Could not verify directly but is a reputable oncology publication

findings.message: All key claims properly attributed with bracketed source references
Neutral, professional tone throughout - no sensationalism or promotional language
Well-structured with clear sections: Overview, What We Know, How the Vaccine Works, What We Don't Know, Analysis
No duplicate content found - first article on this topic

content_preview.title: Moderna-Merck Personalized mRNA Cancer Vaccine Sustains 49% Melanoma Risk Reduction at Five Years
content_preview.summary: Five-year KEYNOTE-942 trial data show Moderna and Merck's individualized neoantigen mRNA vaccine maintains a 49% reduction in melanoma recurrence or death.
content_preview.body_excerpt:
## Overview

Moderna and Merck have reported five-year follow-up data from their Phase 2b KEYNOTE-942 trial showing that intismeran autogene — a personalized mRNA cancer vaccine encoding up to 34 patient-specific neoantigens — combined with Merck's checkpoint inhibitor Keytruda (pembrolizumab), reduced the risk of melanoma recurrence or death by 49% compared to Keytruda alone [1]...
